ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.aggregators

Class Aggregator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.KPIManager
      • ecoware.ecowareprocessor.kpi.aggregators.Aggregator

  • public class Aggregator
extends KPIManager
    Author:
    Armando Varriale This class is an implementation of an "Aggregator KPI". It extends the KPIManager abstract class by adding some specific aspects and provide an adequate implementation of the "launch()" method. An "Aggregator" calculator is a processor that aggregates one or more events among them, correlating a set of secondary events to a specific primary event. For a more detailed presentation of these concepts, see the provided Getting Started section of the ECoWare documentation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Aggregator

        public Aggregator(Element xmlElement,
          String busServer,
          com.espertech.esper.client.Configuration esperConfiguration)
           throws Exception
        Constructs a new Aggregator using the specified XML element. The bus server name (that is the hostname on which the bus server is running) and Esper configuration are also required.
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - the XML element (node) of the configuration file from which retrieve the information to build the KPI object
        busServer - the hostname on which the bus server is running
        esperConfiguration - the Esper current configuration (that is an Configuration object. For further detail see the Esper documentation).
        Throws:
        Exception

        Description copied from class: KPIManager
        This method actually starts the KPI processing.
        This is an abstract method that all classes that extend KPIManager must implement.
